name: The Flare - Prototype
description:
Disclaimer

This game was developed as part of my honours project which investigates the level design priniciples that are required to create a survival horror game.

This game is build for only windows platform 64Bit and can run on medium - high spec computers. It is highly recommened to use headphones and play the game in a dark room.

The game includes flashing lights which could cause epilepsy.

For 18+ only

If you would like to participate in my anonymous research please fill this form. 

Questionnaire : https://forms.gle/wQxzacZWNpZoGL8u7

Story

Our character’s name is Ben. He is a journalist working for one of the most famous news agencies in Germany. About a month ago Ben started working on a story about the Flare virus which occurred few decades ago. He found out that the government had built a secret institution to experiment on patients who had this rare disease and that this facility was somewhere in the Black Forest. Based on Ben's research, a few reporters and investigators have tried to work on this story in the past, but they all have gone missing after trying to find this place. Rumours say that whoever enters the Black Forest never returns. Ben did not believe any of this, so he decided to assemble a small crew and go check out this mysterious forest hoping to find the institution and any clues regarding this rare virus.

When Ben and his crew entered the forest, they couldn’t find anything, so they decided to setup a camp for the night and continue the next day. Ben wakes up feeling cold and strange in his tent during the night and realizes that his crew is no longer there. Feeling strange and scared, Ben starts shouting the names of his crew. He sees a small light in the distance and tries to follow the path towards it. Ben can’t believe his eyes. He comes across a large building which he believes is the institution he was looking for. He decides to enter the building and immediately finds himself locked and lost in the building.

Ben has found himself alone and scared. He must try to find his way out while trying to look for his crew and any clues about the case. Ben must overcome any challenges that may come on this way.
